basics.name: Juan Antonio Robledo Lara
basics.label: Data Scientist
basics.summary: Senior Research Programmer at the Decision Science Center, Tecnológico de Monterrey, specializing in data science and machine learning for climate action, urban development, and sustainable policy. Experienced in predictive modeling, data pipelines, and simulations for large-scale socio-economic and environmental analysis. Holds an M.S. in Computer Science (Machine Learning) from Georgia Tech with prior research roles at IPICyT and Harvard Medical School.

work.name: Tecnológico de Monterrey - Decision Science Center
work.summary: Developing data science and machine learning models for climate action, urban development, and sustainable policy.
highlights: Implemented system dynamics models in Python (societal collapse model, housing affordability model).
Developed ensemble experimentation pipelines and applied unsupervised learning (GMM, KMeans) on time series outputs to identify scenario taxonomies.
Built an XGBoost-based surrogate model to approximate SISEPUEDE outputs for faster optimization workflows.
Engineered a PSO-based calibration pipeline for complex simulation models.
Supported World Bank teams with mitigation pathway simulations via SISEPUEDE (CCDR reports).
Created a hybrid forecasting framework combining Random Forest with ARIMA for CO2-equivalent emissions projections.

work.name: IPICyT
work.summary: Developed Python-based ETL pipelines for air quality data and built predictive models to calibrate sensors.
highlights: Achieved R² > 0.9 in sensor calibration models validated against commercial monitors.
Automated data acquisition and reporting to improve pipeline efficiency.

work.name: Brigham and Women’s Hospital / Harvard Medical School
work.summary: Worked on tissue engineering applications by developing 3D bioprinting solutions and control software.
highlights: Developed a 3D printer for creating small biomaterial constructs.
Built control software and UI using Arduino, C++, and Python.
Designed paper-based devices for in vitro tissue modeling.

skills.name: Programming
keywords: Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, XGBoost, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, Seaborn, SHAP)
